content.body: bakkot: did you get a chance to look at the ecmarkup PR yet?
content.formatted_body: bakkot: did you get a chance to look at the ecmarkup PR yet?

content.body: shu: started reviewing, haven't gotten back to it
content.formatted_body: shu: started reviewing, haven't gotten back to it

content.body: it's at the top my stack now though
no hurry, was just wondering if you had discussed it yesterday when i couldn't open my eyes

Michael Ficarra was of the opinion that we'll probably always have a fixed number of effects and so it would make more sense to have each be its own attribute, rather than having a comma-separated list
content.formatted_body: Michael Ficarra was of the opinion that we'll probably always have a fixed number of effects and so it would make more sense to have each be its own attribute, rather than having a comma-separated list

content.body: also I was wondering about whether the is-invocation attribute should be preserved at runtime - leaning towards no
agreed that it shouldn't be preserved at runtime, was just oversight on my part for not removing
i initially started with a separate attribute, but found it unwieldy to type to have an empty `<dd>`
content.formatted_body: i initially started with a separate attribute, but found it unwieldy to type to have an empty <dd>

content.body: independently i think it's nice to have the effect names propagate as-is so adding new ones don't require ecmarkup changes
that may be overly optimistic, though, if they need special propagation rules
Michael Ficarra: what's the reason for preferring separate attributes?
content.formatted_body: Michael Ficarra: what's the reason for preferring separate attributes?
